abstract: Intel and A.M.D.’s long-running chip feud is carrying over to A.M.D.’s proposed factory spinoff.
snippet: Intel and A.M.D.’s long-running chip feud is carrying over to A.M.D.’s proposed factory spinoff.
lead_paragraph: Things were already pretty tense between the chip makers Intel and Advanced Micro Devices. The two parties are in the midst of a lengthy antitrust battle in which A.M.D. has accused Intel of harming its relationships with PC and server makers. Beyond that, the companies have fought for years as the David and Goliath of the mainstream processor market.

headline.main: Intel and A.M.D. Carry Battle to New Chip Venture

abstract: The Acer Predator, which starts at $1,649 without a monitor, has an Intel Core 2 Quad 2.5-gigahertz processor and an Nvidia GeForce 9600 GT graphics card.
snippet: The Acer Predator, which starts at $1,649 without a monitor, has an Intel Core 2 Quad 2.5-gigahertz processor and an Nvidia GeForce 9600 GT graphics card.
lead_paragraph: Gaming PCs are the gladiators of the computer world. So while most PCs look like a cross between a fax machine and a breadbox, the Acer Predator looks as if it came out of the bowels of the Roman Colosseum.

headline.main: A Gaming Rig With an Intimidating Aura, and That’s Even Before You Look Under the Hood
headline.print_headline: A Gaming Rig With an Intimidating Aura, And That’s Even Before You Look Under the Hood
